thread.title: Portland settles lawsuit filed by anti-abortion activists
thread.title_full: Portland settles lawsuit filed by anti-abortion activists

title: Portland settles lawsuit filed by anti-abortion activists
text:
Portland settles lawsuit filed by anti-abortion activists By - Associated Press   
PORTLAND, Maine (AP) - The city of Portland has settled a lawsuit filed by anti-abortion activists challenging an ordinance that established a 39-foot no-protest zone around a clinic providing abortions. 
The Portland Press Herald reports (http://bit.ly/1krYWn1 ) that Maine’s largest city will pay each of the plaintiffs $1 for damages in addition to a total of $56,500 for legal fees. 
The suit alleged that the ordinance, responsible for creating the buffer zone around a Planned Parenthood location’s entrance, violated their free speech rights. A 2014 U.S. Supreme Court ruling established that a similar no-protest zone in Massachusetts was in violation of free speech rights. 
The Portland City Council repealed the ordinance in question soon after, but a judge determined that protesters could still seek damages for when the buffer zone was in effect. 
___ 
Information from: Portland Press Herald, http://www.pressherald.com
